passages.text: If you want to know your past life, look into your present condition; if you want to know your future life, look at your present actions.
Though my view is as vast as the sky, my attention to karma is as fine as a grain of flour.
Don't invite the future. Don't pursue the past. Let go of the present. Relax, just as you are.
When you recognize the nature of mind, all thoughts are liberated in their own ground.
The nature of mind is like a mirror. It reflects all things but is stained by nothing.
Do not chase after the object of your thoughts. Be like a lion, not like a dog. When you throw a stick, a dog chases the stick. A lion turns to face the thrower.
Mind itself is empty, yet all things appear within it.
Within this body is the Buddha. Do not search elsewhere.
When you are deluded, you are caught by phenomena. When you realize, phenomena are your ornaments.
Let thoughts arise and dissolve. Don't follow them, don't invite them, don't chase them away.
The five poisons, when recognized, are the five wisdoms. Do not reject them.
In the moment of recognition, there is no meditator and nothing to meditate upon.
Sentient beings are Buddhas, but obscured by adventitious stains. When the stains are removed, there is Buddhahood.
This very mind, unborn and unceasing, is the Buddha. There is no Buddha to seek outside.
passages.context: Stop seeking what you already are

passages.text: The appearance is mind. Emptiness is mind. Realization is mind. Delusion is mind. Arising is mind. Cessation is mind.
When death comes, let go of everything. Rest in the nature of mind. That is the only preparation needed.
From confusion arises the whole of samsara. From recognizing the nature of confusion arises the whole of nirvana.
Do not alter the mind. Leave it in its natural state. That which does not alter is the path.
All phenomena are projections of the mind. Mind itself has no foundationâ€”it is empty and luminous.
In the future, when beings' minds are coarse and the dark age deepens, I will appear in many forms to help them. Look for me then.
